Qualifiers.scope: Gross floor area (GFA) accounting for entryway features that are considered vaulted entryways, as depicted in Figure 8.
applicability: Buildings with an entryway that is considered a vaulted entryway.
Measurement of the entryway area for inclusion in GFA.
ambiguities: The phrase 'considered to be a vaulted entryway' is undefined; criteria for determining a vaulted entryway are not provided.
Measurement boundary 'outside material of the entry-way feature' is not specified (e.g., face of cladding, trim, column edges).
Units for area measurement are not stated; presume jurisdictional standard units for GFA.

Variables.name: entryway_floor_area_footprint
Variables.description: Plan area of the entryway feature to be counted toward GFA.
Variables.measurement_reference: Measured to the outside material of the entry-way feature.

Variables.name: recessed_portion_included
Variables.description: Indicates whether portions of the entryway recessed beyond the house facade and roof are included in area counting.
Variables.notes: Text states recessed portions are included in the area that counts.

Variables.name: grade_elevation
Variables.description: Grade reference used in the isometric/side elevation views (contextual; not used directly in area counting rule).

Variables.name: front_facade_to_2nd_floor_intersection_elevation
Variables.description: Elevation at the intersection of the front facade and underside/bottom of 2nd floor (contextual marker).

Constants.name: vaulted_entry_gfa_count_multiplier
Constants.spec: The area counts TWICE toward gross floor area if the entryway is a vaulted entryway.

mandatory.condition: The entryway must be considered a vaulted entryway.
Measure the entryway area to the outside material of the entry-way feature.
Include portions of the entryway that are recessed beyond the house facade and roof in the area that counts.

conditional_logic.if: entryway is considered a vaulted entryway
conditional_logic.then: entryway_floor_area_footprint contributes to GFA with a multiplier of 2 (counts twice)

Exceptions: No explicit exceptions or exclusions stated beyond inclusion of recessed portions.

hierarchical: This rule is the base counting rule for vaulted entryways.
cross_references: Figure 8: Entry feature with 2nd floor above.
Porch Floor Plan: Outline of entryway floor area that counts TWICE if entryway is vaulted.
Isometric View and Side Elevation labels provide contextual geometry markers (Height, Grade, Top/Bottom of 2nd Floor).
logical_dependencies: Applies independently, but forms the basis for the extended case when a 2nd floor is above the vaulted entry (see related rule where total count becomes three times).

Qualifiers.scope: Gross floor area (GFA) accounting for configurations where a second floor exists above a vaulted entryway.
applicability: Buildings with an entryway that is a vaulted entryway AND has a 2nd floor above that entry feature.
ambiguities: The phrase '2nd floor over a vaulted entry will count as usual' is undefined; 'as usual' counting method is not specified in this excerpt.
Units for area measurement are not stated; presume jurisdictional standard units for GFA.

Variables.name: entryway_floor_area_footprint
Variables.description: Plan area of the vaulted entryway feature (same measurement method as base rule: to outside material).

Variables.name: second_floor_area_over_entry
Variables.description: Plan area of the second floor located above the vaulted entry footprint.
Variables.notes: Counted 'as usual' per general GFA rules.

Variables.name: has_second_floor_above_entry
Variables.description: Presence of a second floor above the vaulted entryway.

Constants.name: total_gfa_count_multiplier_when_2nd_floor_over_vaulted_entry
Constants.spec: The area will count three times toward gross floor area when a 2nd floor is over a vaulted entry.

Constants.name: second_floor_counts_as_usual
Constants.spec: The 2nd floor over a vaulted entry will count as usual (exact method not defined in this excerpt).

mandatory.condition: Entryway must qualify as a vaulted entryway per the base rule.
A second floor must exist above the vaulted entryway.

conditional_logic.if: has_second_floor_above_entry == true AND entryway is a vaulted entryway
conditional_logic.then: The combined GFA counting for the affected area is three times total: two times for the vaulted entry footprint plus one time for the second floor area counted as usual.
conditional_logic.notes: This is expressed succinctly in the text as 'the area will count three times toward gross floor area'.

Exceptions: No explicit exceptions or alternatives provided.

hierarchical: This rule extends the base vaulted entry counting rule by adding the second-floor component.
cross_references: Figure 8: Entry feature with 2nd floor above.
Side Elevation labels: Intersection of front facade and underside or bottom of 2nd floor; Top/Bottom of 2nd Floor.
logical_dependencies: Depends on the base vaulted entry rule (vaulted entry counts twice).
Also depends on the general GFA rule for second floors ('counts as usual'), not defined in this excerpt.
